Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jacob J. Ligman was found guilty of Resisting/Failing to Stop, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • Jacob J. Ligman was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Remaining balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Absolute Sobriety. No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.

Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

No contact with:  Victim in 20CM1846 unless Victim consents, and agent agrees.

No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: See Count 1 for additional conditions of probation.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.

Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
  Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Village of Chenequa Police Department.

timeConds.notes:
Huber (all standard release conditions including work, work search, treatment, and supervised visits with his son at Family Corner in West Bend).

*Consecutive to sentence in Washington County
09-07-2022 COURT HAS NO OBJECTION TO THE DEFENDANT SERVING HIS SENTENCE IN WASHINGTON COUNTY IF ACCEPTED.

Letter from Defendant's employer dated September 6, 2022.

**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on September 7, 2022 - The Court has no objection to the defendant serving his sentence in Washington County if they will accept him. The JOC will be amended accordingly.**
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

02:40 PM Defendant Jacob J. Ligman in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea and sentencing in 22CF273 and sentencing in 20CM1846. 
Court had received a note that the victim wanted to appear by zoom, but no one appeared.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
State has filed an Amended Information. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of Amended Information and waives reading.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.

State places offer on the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy.
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Amended Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Counts 3 & 4 are Dismissed and read in.
Count 5 is Dismissed by operation of law.
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations.

In case 22CF273:
COUNT 1: 
Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  2 YEARS; 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed;
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions;
*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
*No contact with:  Victim in 20CM1846 unless Victim consents, and agent agrees; 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done;
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license;

COSTS:  $243
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.  
*Cash held in 21CM02 may be applied. 

***********************
COUNT 2:
Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  2  YEARS; 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Same as Count 1; 

CONDITION TIME: 90  DAYS in the Waukesha County Jail w/Huber (all standard release conditions including work, work search, treatment, and supervised visits with his son at Family Corner in West Bend).
*Consecutive to sentence in Washington County; 
  
D/L REVOCATION: 24 months.
IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

FINE: $3,014 , includes IID surcharge; 
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Village of Chenequa Police Department. 
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.  

***********************
In case 20CM1846:   
The Defendant was sentenced to the following:
JAIL: 10  Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
2 Days Credit.
To run Concurrent to time being served in Washington County case; 

Costs:  $243
Domestic Violence Surcharge: 100
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
*Costs/Surcharges are a condition of probation in case 22CF273.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver, signed
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

03:03 PM Defendant Jacob J. Ligman in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for waiver of preliminary hearing.
The defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.
Court finds the defendant knowingly, freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their right to a preliminary hearing and finds probable cause to bind over the defendant over for trial.
Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Information filed.    
Court finds probably cause to bind Defendant over for trial. 
Defense requests Huber Bailee status.
State opposes the request for reasons as stated on the record.
Court denies request for Huber Bailee status.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Motion to Modify Bail filed by Atty. Menden.
Waiver of Prelim on March 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

CASH BOND MODIFIED FROM $3,500 DOWN TO $750 WITH THE SAME CONDITIONS. 

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Defendant to have no contact with the caller to the Sheriff's Department listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

03:25 PM Defendant Jacob J. Ligman in court, in custody, with attorney Perri on behalf of Eryn M Menden.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called to address motion to modify bond. 
Defense requests $500 cash bond for reasons as stated on the record.
State opposes modification of bond.
Court modifies bond down to $750 with the same conditions. 
Defense requests adjournment of Preliminary Hearing scheduled for tomorrow advising the court that time limits were previously waived. 

  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
to the Court filed by Atty. Menden requesting adjournment of 3/3 bail/bond hearing.
Bail/bond hearing on March 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Motion to Modify Bail filed by Atty. Eryn Menden.
Preliminary hearing on March 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.

01:11 PM Defendant Jacob J. Ligman in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden states she is willing to waive the 10 days for the preliminary hearing but requests this matter be put on for a preliminary hearing as soon as possible.  Court adjourns preliminary hearing and will set it as soon as possible.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.

filed by Atty. Menden to adjourn prelim date. Sent to CC Rieck to review. Court's response: Date to be rescheduled. Move to 1pm and set for hearing or status of prelim, prelim time limits to be waived and schedule new date.
